svcproc.title: HEATER BLOWER MOTOR OPERATION (MANUAL AND THERMOSTAT CONTROLS)

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 3 for the following discussion.

svcsubproc.title: AUXILIARY BUNK BLOWER RELAY (147)
svcsubproc.para: With the key ON, power from A1 Accessory Adapter (499) energizes the Auxiliary Bunk Blower relay (147). With this relay energized, battery power from 20A fuse F10-A is applied to:

svcsubproc.title: BLOWER MOTOR SWITCH (593)
svcsubproc.para: In the Low speed position, switch terminal L is connected to Sleeper Blower Resistor Network terminal 4. Power from the blower switch goes through the resistor network and thermocouple and approximately four volts is applied to the blower motor ( Figure 4).

In the Medium speed position, switch terminal M is connected to Sleeper Blower Resistor Network terminal 3. Power from the blower switch goes through the resistor network and thermocouple, and approximately six volts is applied to the blower motor ( Figure 4 ).

In the High speed position, switch terminal H is connected to the High Speed Blower Relay (584) at control coil terminal 86. This causes the relay to energize, closing the normally open contact between relay terminals 30 and 87. With the contact closed power from Auxiliary Bunk Blower Relay (147) passes through relay (584), then through the sleeper blower resistor network thermocouple and full battery voltage is applied to the blower motor ( Figure 4 ).
